intro: Tinnea stolzii, commonly known as the Stolz's tinnea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Tinnea stolzii is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats, making it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
